name: Aptis General Writing Task 1 - Email/Letter
description: Formal or informal email/letter responding to a given situation

task_fulfillment.description: How well the candidate addresses all parts of the task

levels.0-1: Minimal attempt to address the task. Little or no relevant content.
levels.2-3: Limited attempt to address the task. Some relevant content but major gaps.
levels.4-5: Adequate attempt to address the task. Most requirements covered.
levels.6-7: Good attempt to address the task. All requirements clearly addressed.
levels.8-9: Excellent response. All requirements fully and effectively addressed.

coherence.description: Organization and logical flow of ideas

levels.0-1: No clear organization. Ideas disconnected and confusing.
levels.2-3: Limited organization. Some attempt at structure but unclear progression.
levels.4-5: Generally organized. Clear beginning, middle, and end with some transitions.
levels.6-7: Well organized. Clear structure with good use of linking devices.
levels.8-9: Excellently organized. Seamless flow with sophisticated linking.

vocabulary.description: Range and accuracy of vocabulary used

levels.0-1: Very limited vocabulary. Frequent errors that impede communication.
levels.2-3: Limited vocabulary. Some errors but basic meaning conveyed.
levels.4-5: Adequate vocabulary for the task. Some variety with minor errors.
levels.6-7: Good range of vocabulary. Effective word choice with few errors.
levels.8-9: Excellent vocabulary range. Sophisticated and precise word choice.

grammar.description: Range and accuracy of grammatical structures

levels.0-1: Very limited grammar. Frequent errors that impede communication.
levels.2-3: Limited grammatical range. Some control but frequent errors.
levels.4-5: Adequate grammatical range. Generally accurate with some errors.
levels.6-7: Good grammatical range and accuracy. Complex structures attempted.
levels.8-9: Excellent grammatical control. Wide range used accurately and flexibly.

prompts.text: You recently bought an item online but when it arrived, it was damaged. Write an email to the customer service department describing the problem and asking for a replacement.
Your English-speaking friend is visiting your city next week. Write an email inviting them to stay with you and suggesting some activities you could do together.
You saw a job advertisement for a part-time position at a local bookstore. Write an email to the manager expressing your interest and explaining why you would be suitable for the job.

name: Aptis General Writing Task 2 - Article/Report
description: Article or report on a given topic expressing opinions and ideas

task_fulfillment.description: How well the candidate addresses all parts of the task and develops ideas

levels.0-1: Minimal attempt to address the task. Little or no development of ideas.
levels.2-3: Limited attempt to address the task. Some ideas presented but underdeveloped.
levels.4-5: Adequate attempt to address the task. Ideas generally developed appropriately.
levels.6-7: Good attempt to address the task. Ideas well-developed and supported.
levels.8-9: Excellent response. Ideas fully developed with sophisticated reasoning.

levels.0-1: No clear organization. Ideas presented randomly without logical connection.
levels.2-3: Limited organization. Some attempt at paragraphing but unclear development.
levels.4-5: Generally organized. Clear paragraphs with adequate development.
levels.6-7: Well organized. Effective paragraphing with clear topic development.
levels.8-9: Excellently organized. Sophisticated structure with seamless progression.

vocabulary.description: Range, accuracy, and appropriateness of vocabulary

levels.0-1: Very limited vocabulary. Frequent errors affecting meaning.
levels.2-3: Limited vocabulary. Some variety but frequent inaccuracies.
levels.4-5: Adequate vocabulary. Sufficient range with some effective word choice.
levels.6-7: Good vocabulary range. Effective and generally accurate usage.
levels.8-9: Excellent vocabulary. Wide range used precisely and effectively.

grammar.description: Range, accuracy, and complexity of grammatical structures

levels.0-1: Very limited grammatical range. Errors impede communication.
levels.2-3: Limited grammatical structures. Some accuracy but frequent errors.
levels.4-5: Adequate range of structures. Generally accurate with some complexity.
levels.6-7: Good range of structures. Accurate use of complex grammar.
levels.8-9: Excellent grammatical control. Wide range used accurately and flexibly.

prompts.text: Write an article for your school magazine about how technology has changed the way young people communicate. Include your opinion on whether these changes are positive or negative.
Your local council is looking for ways to make your town more environmentally friendly. Write a report suggesting three practical changes and explaining why each would be beneficial.
Write an article for a travel website about the benefits of learning a foreign language before visiting another country. Share your personal experiences or observations.

name: Aptis Advanced Writing Task 1 - Formal Letter/Email

task_fulfillment.description: Complete and appropriate response to all task requirements

levels.0-1: Task barely attempted. Irrelevant or inadequate content.
levels.2-3: Limited response. Some task requirements addressed superficially.
levels.4-5: Adequate response. Most requirements addressed appropriately.
levels.6-7: Good response. All requirements addressed effectively.
levels.8-9: Excellent response. All requirements fully and skillfully addressed.

levels.0-1: No apparent organization. Incoherent presentation of ideas.
levels.2-3: Limited organization. Some structure but poor cohesion.
levels.4-5: Generally well-organized. Clear structure with adequate cohesion.
levels.6-7: Well-organized. Effective use of cohesive devices.
levels.8-9: Excellently organized. Sophisticated and seamless cohesion.

levels.0-1: Very limited vocabulary inappropriate for level.
levels.2-3: Limited vocabulary. Some attempt at formal register.
levels.4-5: Adequate vocabulary. Generally appropriate formal language.
levels.6-7: Good vocabulary range. Effective formal register maintained.
levels.8-9: Excellent vocabulary. Sophisticated and precise formal language.

levels.0-1: Very limited grammar. Frequent errors affect communication.
levels.2-3: Limited grammatical range. Some accuracy but many errors.
levels.4-5: Adequate range. Generally accurate with some complex structures.
levels.6-7: Good range and accuracy. Complex structures handled well.
levels.8-9: Excellent grammatical control. Complex structures used accurately.

prompts.text: You recently attended a professional development course that was poorly organized and did not meet the advertised standards. Write a formal letter to the training institute requesting a full refund and explaining your concerns about their service quality.

Your company is considering implementing a flexible working policy. Write a formal proposal to the management team outlining the benefits and potential challenges of remote work arrangements, and provide specific recommendations.
